conclusion: To determine if the distance fallen during 10 to 15 seconds is greater or less than 75 meters, analyze the velocity-time graph.
The x-axis represents time in seconds, and the y-axis represents velocity in meters per second. The graph shows the velocity of the skydiver over time.
At t = 10 seconds, the velocity is 20 m/s. At t = 15 seconds, the velocity is 10 m/s. The velocity decreases linearly between these points.
Calculate average velocity using the formula: Average velocity = (Final velocity + Initial velocity) / 2.
Substitute values to find average velocity: (10 m/s + 20 m/s) / 2 = 15 m/s.
Calculate distance fallen using: Distance = Average velocity × Time interval.
Substitute values to find distance: 15 m/s × 5 s = 75 meters.
The distance fallen during the 10 to 15 seconds interval is exactly 75 meters.
